SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

nz.govt.natlib.fx
Class ParserContext

java.lang.Object
  nz.govt.natlib.fx.ParserContext

public final class ParserContext
extends java.lang.Object

ParserContext is a class that represents the context of a particular parsing operation. This 'context' is philosophically similiar a SAX based parser. A file being parsed is typically represented by a number of nested 'sections': [[header][data|config|text][data header[blocks][offset]][block 1][block 2][block n]] the above is just an example but you can see that when a file like this is being parsed a number of 'events' can occur. 1. the header is read some data is read from the header and the section ends 2. the next section is read i.e. data, config or text and an event occurs, and the section ends 3. the data header is read 3a. the number of blocks is read 3b. the offset of the blocks is read 4. the data header section ends 5. each block is read... Firing events for every section and associated data allows a parser to continue on without leaking memory by building up an object model. Output listeners can stream the information out in any format as the input file is parsed. (XML for instance)

Version:
1.0
Author:
Nic Evans

Constructor Detail

ParserContext

public ParserContext()
Creates a new ParserContext and adds a default listener that gathers attributes as the parse continues.

Method Detail

addListener

public void addListener(ParserListener listener)
Add a listener to the parser. When events occur during the parsing (such as elements reading discrete information) the parser (this) notifies the listeners (in no particular order)

Parameters:
listener - a listener to be notified of events.

fireStartParseEvent

public void fireStartParseEvent(java.lang.String name)
'Fires' a start event. a start event is a new 'section' of data being read. For the XMLParserListener, this opens a tag with the supplied name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the section to open.

fireStartParseEvent

public void fireStartParseEvent(java.lang.String name,
                                boolean internal,
                                java.util.HashMap parameters)
This method starts a new 'section' of the parse. For the XMLParserListener this call writes an open tag with the supplied name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the section to open.
internal - true if the event is internal. Some listeners may elect to perform special handling with internal events.
parameters - A hashmap of parameters associated with the event. The ParserListener is responsible for handling the parameters. The XMLParserListener adds them as standard XML tag attributes.

fireParseEvent

public void fireParseEvent(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.Object value)
Send a single value metadata element to the parser. 'Fires' a simple single 'section' with associated data event. Note this method will result in a startEvent, dataEvent and endEvent. For example, the XMLParserListener will display the following for a call to fieParseEvent("MOD_DATE", "12/12/2006"); 12/12/2006

Parameters:
name - The name of the metadata element.
value - The value of the metadata element.

fireParseEvent

public void fireParseEvent(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.Object value,
                           boolean internal,
                           java.util.HashMap parameters)
'Fires' a simple single 'section' with associated data event. Note this method will result in a startEvent, dataEvent and endEvent.

Parameters:
name - The name of the metadata element.
value - The value of the metadata element.
internal - True if this is an internal event. Some parsers may elect not to output internal events.
parameters - A map of parameters associated with this event.

fireParseEvent

public void fireParseEvent(java.lang.Object value,
                           boolean internal)
Send a value directly to the parser. This should be preceded by a fireStartParseEvent and tailed by a fireEndParseEvent call.

Parameters:
value - The value to output.
internal - true if this is an internal event. Some parsers may have special handling for internal events.

fireEndParseEvent

public void fireEndParseEvent(java.lang.String name)
Ends a 'section' of the metadata.

Parameters:
name - The name of the section to end.

fireEndParseEvent

public void fireEndParseEvent(java.lang.String name,
                              boolean internal)
Ends a 'section' of the metadata.

Parameters:
name - The name of the section to end.
internal - if the event is an internal event - listeners may have specific behaviour for these
